maml:description.maml:para: List CDNs
Fetch predefined list of CDN providers. You can configure your MSL origin to include multiple CDN providers.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

List CP codes
Obtains CP codes based on provided -Type. You need a CP code to create a stream.
Specify the type of CP code. Specify `INGEST` to obtain the INGEST CP codes, `DELIVERY` for the delivery CP codes, and `STORAGE` for the storage CP codes.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
When enabled, lists only CP codes that have not already been used to provision an origin.

Get a stream
Retrieves detailed information about the requested stream.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Specifies the page number to view, starting at 1.
Indicates the number of data points that are displayed per page. The default is to display all data if you don't specify the page size.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Sorts the fields displayed based on the key that you specify, either `cpcode`, `createdDate`, `dvrWindowInMin`, `format`, `modifiedDate`, `name`, `originHostName`, `status`, or `zone`.
Sorts the streams list in ascending (`ASC`) or descending (`DESC`) order.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each stream.

Create a CP code
Creates a new MSL CP code. You need a CP code to create a stream or an origin.
Name of the CP code.
The ID of the contract associated with the CP code. Run `Get-Contract` from the Akamai.Property module to see these.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the CP code.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Specify the type of CP code. Specify `INGEST` to obtain the INGEST CP codes, `DELIVERY` for the delivery CP codes, and `STORAGE` for the storage CP codes.

Specify the type of CP code. Specify `INGEST` to obtain the INGEST CP codes, `DELIVERY` for the delivery CP codes, and `STORAGE` for the storage CP codes.
Create a new origin

Create a Media Services live origin for the stream. You can associate this origin hostname with an Adaptive Media Delivery configuration. Note: due to the complexity of the request body, it may be easier to retrieve an existing origin (should one exist), edit the details locally and pipe to this function.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a stream

Provisions a new stream. The process of creating or updating any stream changes its status to `PENDING`. When all of the steps are complete, the stream status changes to `PROVISIONED`. If any of the steps fail, the stream status changes to `FAILED`. It takes two to three hours to provision a stream. Note: due to the complexity of the request body, it may be easier to retrieve an existing stream (if one exists), edit the details locally and pipe to this function.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Specifies the stream to clone the internal settings from.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Specifies the stream to clone the internal settings from.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Remove an origin
Deletes the specified origin.
Unique identifier for each origin.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each origin.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Remove a stream

Deletes the specified stream. If you delete an archived stream, but do not include `-PurgeContent` the stream will be permanently deleted, but any archived content saved on NetStorage will continue to incur billing. If you do set `-PurgeContent`, the stream will be permanently deleted and any archived content saved on NetStorage for this stream will also be deleted and cannot be restored.
Unique identifier for each stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
This value determines whether to delete archived content on NetStorage.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
This value determines whether to delete archived content on NetStorage.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each stream.
Update an origin

Updates certain fields of the origin. You can also use this API to rotate keys. Populate `previousKey` and `previousKeyExpiryDate` fields if you need your old keys to be valid for a certain amount of time even after rotating. Note: this function supports the pipeline, and can also read the OriginID from the piped object.
Unique identifier for each origin.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each origin.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Update a stream

Modifies an existing stream. The request body object must be identical in structure to the Get Stream Details response object. You can edit the `name`, `ingestAccelerated`, `password`, `dvrWindow`, `allowedIps`, and `additionalEmailIds` members. If you try to edit any other member, the API returns a `400` error. Note: this function supports the pipeline, and can also read the StreamID from the piped object.
Unique identifier for each stream.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each stream.
